story.text: (Adds background, shares)AMSTERDAM Jan 2 (Reuters) - Dutch specialist market maker Van der Moolen Holding VDMN.ASVDM.N said on Tuesday it had issued 1.9 million new shares as part of a settlement of the earn-out agreement on its Curvalue acquisition. An amount of 940,679 euros ($1.24 million) was paid in December 2006, as part of the agreement, Van der Moolen said in a statement. "The amount of the earn-out payment is based on the profitability of Curvalue in 2005 relative to pre-established profit targets," the company said. The Curvalue acquisition was completed in January 2006 and its founder Richard den Drijver was appointed as Van der Moolens's new chief executive. Van der Moolen shares were up 0.9 percent at around 0815 GMT on Tuesday in line with the Dutch Midcap-index which was up 0.6 percent. Van der Moolen is also listed in New York VDM.N where it is one of the top-five market makers. The bulk of the group's trading income is generated in the United States.
story.title: update 1 - moolen issues 1 . 9 mln new shares for acquisition
